table.name: geography_columns
table.viewSql: SELECT current_database() AS f_table_catalog, n.nspname AS f_table_schema, c.relname AS f_table_name, a.attname AS f_geography_column, postgis_typmod_dims(a.atttypmod) AS coord_dimension, postgis_typmod_srid(a.atttypmod) AS srid, postgis_typmod_type(a.atttypmod) AS type FROM pg_class c, pg_attribute a, pg_type t, pg_namespace n WHERE ((t.typname = 'geography'::name) AND (a.attisdropped = false) AND (a.atttypid = t.oid) AND (a.attrelid = c.oid) AND (c.relnamespace = n.oid) AND (c.relkind = ANY (ARRAY['r'::"char", 'v'::"char", 'm'::"char", 'f'::"char", 'p'::"char"])) AND (NOT pg_is_other_temp_schema(c.relnamespace)) AND has_table_privilege(c.oid, 'SELECT'::text));

table.name: geometry_columns
table.viewSql: SELECT (current_database())::character varying(256) AS f_table_catalog, n.nspname AS f_table_schema, c.relname AS f_table_name, a.attname AS f_geometry_column, COALESCE(postgis_typmod_dims(a.atttypmod), sn.ndims, 2) AS coord_dimension, COALESCE(NULLIF(postgis_typmod_srid(a.atttypmod), 0), sr.srid, 0) AS srid, (replace(replace(COALESCE(NULLIF(upper(postgis_typmod_type(a.atttypmod)), 'GEOMETRY'::text), st.type, 'GEOMETRY'::text), 'ZM'::text, ''::text), 'Z'::text, ''::text))::character varying(30) AS type FROM ((((((pg_class c JOIN pg_attribute a ON (((a.attrelid = c.oid) AND (NOT a.attisdropped)))) JOIN pg_namespace n ON ((c.relnamespace = n.oid))) JOIN pg_type t ON ((a.atttypid = t.oid))) LEFT JOIN ( SELECT s.connamespace, s.conrelid, s.conkey, replace(split_part(s.consrc, ''''::text, 2), ')'::text, ''::text) AS type FROM ( SELECT pg_constraint.connamespace, pg_constraint.conrelid, pg_constraint.conkey, pg_get_constraintdef(pg_constraint.oid) AS consrc FROM pg_constraint) s WHERE (s.consrc ~~* '%geometrytype(% = %'::text)) st ON (((st.connamespace = n.oid) AND (st.conrelid = c.oid) AND (a.attnum = ANY (st.conkey))))) LEFT JOIN ( SELECT s.connamespace, s.conrelid, s.conkey, (replace(split_part(s.consrc, ' = '::text, 2), ')'::text, ''::text))::integer AS ndims FROM ( SELECT pg_constraint.connamespace, pg_constraint.conrelid, pg_constraint.conkey, pg_get_constraintdef(pg_constraint.oid) AS consrc FROM pg_constraint) s WHERE (s.consrc ~~* '%ndims(% = %'::text)) sn ON (((sn.connamespace = n.oid) AND (sn.conrelid = c.oid) AND (a.attnum = ANY (sn.conkey))))) LEFT JOIN ( SELECT s.connamespace, s.conrelid, s.conkey, (replace(replace(split_part(s.consrc, ' = '::text, 2), ')'::text, ''::text), '('::text, ''::text))::integer AS srid FROM ( SELECT pg_constraint.connamespace, pg_constraint.conrelid, pg_constraint.conkey, pg_get_constraintdef(pg_constraint.oid) AS consrc FROM pg_constraint) s WHERE (s.consrc ~~* '%srid(% = %'::text)) sr ON (((sr.connamespace = n.oid) AND (sr.conrelid = c.oid) AND (a.attnum = ANY (sr.conkey))))) WHERE ((c.relkind = ANY (ARRAY['r'::"char", 'v'::"char", 'm'::"char", 'f'::"char", 'p'::"char"])) AND (NOT (c.relname = 'raster_columns'::name)) AND (t.typname = 'geometry'::name) AND (NOT pg_is_other_temp_schema(c.relnamespace)) AND has_table_privilege(c.oid, 'SELECT'::text));

table.name: pg_stat_statements
table.viewSql: SELECT pg_stat_statements.userid, pg_stat_statements.dbid, pg_stat_statements.queryid, pg_stat_statements.query, pg_stat_statements.calls, pg_stat_statements.total_time, pg_stat_statements.min_time, pg_stat_statements.max_time, pg_stat_statements.mean_time, pg_stat_statements.stddev_time, pg_stat_statements.rows, pg_stat_statements.shared_blks_hit, pg_stat_statements.shared_blks_read, pg_stat_statements.shared_blks_dirtied, pg_stat_statements.shared_blks_written, pg_stat_statements.local_blks_hit, pg_stat_statements.local_blks_read, pg_stat_statements.local_blks_dirtied, pg_stat_statements.local_blks_written, pg_stat_statements.temp_blks_read, pg_stat_statements.temp_blks_written, pg_stat_statements.blk_read_time, pg_stat_statements.blk_write_time FROM pg_stat_statements(true) pg_stat_statements(userid, dbid, queryid, query, calls, total_time, min_time, max_time, mean_time, stddev_time, rows, shared_blks_hit, shared_blks_read, shared_blks_dirtied, shared_blks_written, local_blks_hit, local_blks_read, local_blks_dirtied, local_blks_written, temp_blks_read, temp_blks_written, blk_read_time, blk_write_time);

table.name: raster_columns
table.viewSql: SELECT current_database() AS r_table_catalog, n.nspname AS r_table_schema, c.relname AS r_table_name, a.attname AS r_raster_column, COALESCE(_raster_constraint_info_srid(n.nspname, c.relname, a.attname), ( SELECT st_srid('010100000000000000000000000000000000000000'::geometry) AS st_srid)) AS srid, _raster_constraint_info_scale(n.nspname, c.relname, a.attname, 'x'::bpchar) AS scale_x, _raster_constraint_info_scale(n.nspname, c.relname, a.attname, 'y'::bpchar) AS scale_y, _raster_constraint_info_blocksize(n.nspname, c.relname, a.attname, 'width'::text) AS blocksize_x, _raster_constraint_info_blocksize(n.nspname, c.relname, a.attname, 'height'::text) AS blocksize_y, COALESCE(_raster_constraint_info_alignment(n.nspname, c.relname, a.attname), false) AS same_alignment, COALESCE(_raster_constraint_info_regular_blocking(n.nspname, c.relname, a.attname), false) AS regular_blocking, _raster_constraint_info_num_bands(n.nspname, c.relname, a.attname) AS num_bands, _raster_constraint_info_pixel_types(n.nspname, c.relname, a.attname) AS pixel_types, _raster_constraint_info_nodata_values(n.nspname, c.relname, a.attname) AS nodata_values, _raster_constraint_info_out_db(n.nspname, c.relname, a.attname) AS out_db, _raster_constraint_info_extent(n.nspname, c.relname, a.attname) AS extent, COALESCE(_raster_constraint_info_index(n.nspname, c.relname, a.attname), false) AS spatial_index FROM pg_class c, pg_attribute a, pg_type t, pg_namespace n WHERE ((t.typname = 'raster'::name) AND (a.attisdropped = false) AND (a.atttypid = t.oid) AND (a.attrelid = c.oid) AND (c.relnamespace = n.oid) AND (c.relkind = ANY (ARRAY['r'::"char", 'v'::"char", 'm'::"char", 'f'::"char", 'p'::"char"])) AND (NOT pg_is_other_temp_schema(c.relnamespace)) AND has_table_privilege(c.oid, 'SELECT'::text));

table.name: raster_overviews
table.viewSql: SELECT current_database() AS o_table_catalog, n.nspname AS o_table_schema, c.relname AS o_table_name, a.attname AS o_raster_column, current_database() AS r_table_catalog, (split_part(split_part(s.consrc, '''::name'::text, 1), ''''::text, 2))::name AS r_table_schema, (split_part(split_part(s.consrc, '''::name'::text, 2), ''''::text, 2))::name AS r_table_name, (split_part(split_part(s.consrc, '''::name'::text, 3), ''''::text, 2))::name AS r_raster_column, (btrim(split_part(s.consrc, ','::text, 2)))::integer AS overview_factor FROM pg_class c, pg_attribute a, pg_type t, pg_namespace n, ( SELECT pg_constraint.connamespace, pg_constraint.conrelid, pg_constraint.conkey, pg_get_constraintdef(pg_constraint.oid) AS consrc FROM pg_constraint) s WHERE ((t.typname = 'raster'::name) AND (a.attisdropped = false) AND (a.atttypid = t.oid) AND (a.attrelid = c.oid) AND (c.relnamespace = n.oid) AND ((c.relkind)::text = ANY ((ARRAY['r'::character(1), 'v'::character(1), 'm'::character(1), 'f'::character(1)])::text[])) AND (s.connamespace = n.oid) AND (s.conrelid = c.oid) AND (s.consrc ~~ '%_overview_constraint(%'::text) AND (NOT pg_is_other_temp_schema(c.relnamespace)) AND has_table_privilege(c.oid, 'SELECT'::text));

_add_raster_constraint(cn name, sql text)
_add_raster_constraint_alignment(rastschema name, rasttable name, rastcolumn name)

_add_raster_constraint_coverage_tile(rastschema name, rasttable name, rastcolumn name)

_drop_raster_constraint_spatially_unique(rastschema name, rasttable name, rastcolumn name)
routine.definition:
DECLARE cn text; BEGIN SELECT s.conname INTO cn FROM pg_class c, pg_namespace n, pg_attribute a , (SELECT connamespace, conname, conrelid, conkey, conindid, contype, conexclop, pg_get_constraintdef(oid) As consrc FROM pg_constraint) AS s , pg_index idx, pg_operator op WHERE n.nspname = $1 AND c.relname = $2 AND a.attname = $3 AND a.attrelid = c.oid AND s.connamespace = n.oid AND s.conrelid = c.oid AND s.contype = 'x' AND 0::smallint = ANY (s.conkey) AND idx.indexrelid = s.conindid AND pg_get_indexdef(idx.indexrelid, 1, true) LIKE '(' || quote_ident($3) || '::%geometry)' AND s.conexclop[1] = op.oid AND op.oprname = '=';
RETURN public._drop_raster_constraint($1, $2, cn); END;

routine.name: _overview_constraint(ov raster, factor integer, refschema name, reftable name, refcolumn name)
routine.definition: SELECT COALESCE((SELECT TRUE FROM public.raster_columns WHERE r_table_catalog = current_database() AND r_table_schema = $3 AND r_table_name = $4 AND r_raster_column = $5), FALSE)

routine.name: _overview_constraint_info(ovschema name, ovtable name, ovcolumn name, OUT refschema name, OUT reftable name, OUT refcolumn name, OUT factor integer)
routine.definition: SELECT split_part(split_part(s.consrc, '''::name', 1), '''', 2)::name, split_part(split_part(s.consrc, '''::name', 2), '''', 2)::name, split_part(split_part(s.consrc, '''::name', 3), '''', 2)::name, trim(both from split_part(s.consrc, ',', 2))::integer FROM pg_class c, pg_namespace n, pg_attribute a , (SELECT connamespace, conrelid, conkey, pg_get_constraintdef(oid) As consrc FROM pg_constraint) AS s WHERE n.nspname = $1 AND c.relname = $2 AND a.attname = $3 AND a.attrelid = c.oid AND s.connamespace = n.oid AND s.conrelid = c.oid AND a.attnum = ANY (s.conkey) AND s.consrc LIKE '%_overview_constraint(%'

routine.name: _postgis_deprecate(oldname text, newname text, version text)
_postgis_pgsql_version()
routine.definition: SELECT CASE WHEN split_part(s,'.',1)::integer > 9 THEN split_part(s,'.',1) || '0' ELSE split_part(s,'.', 1) || split_part(s,'.', 2) END AS v FROM substring(version(), 'PostgreSQL ([0-9\.]+)') AS s;

routine.name: _postgis_selectivity(tbl regclass, att_name text, geom geometry, mode text DEFAULT '2'::text)
_raster_constraint_info_alignment(rastschema name, rasttable name, rastcolumn name)
routine.definition: SELECT TRUE FROM pg_class c, pg_namespace n, pg_attribute a , (SELECT connamespace, conrelid, conkey, pg_get_constraintdef(oid) As consrc FROM pg_constraint) AS s WHERE n.nspname = $1 AND c.relname = $2 AND a.attname = $3 AND a.attrelid = c.oid AND s.connamespace = n.oid AND s.conrelid = c.oid AND a.attnum = ANY (s.conkey) AND s.consrc LIKE '%st_samealignment(%';

routine.name: _raster_constraint_info_blocksize(rastschema name, rasttable name, rastcolumn name, axis text)
routine.definition: SELECT CASE WHEN strpos(s.consrc, 'ANY (ARRAY[') > 0 THEN split_part((substring(s.consrc FROM E'ARRAY\\[(.*?){1}\\]')), ',', 1)::integer ELSE regexp_replace( split_part(s.consrc, '= ', 2), '[\(\)]', '', 'g' )::integer END FROM pg_class c, pg_namespace n, pg_attribute a , (SELECT connamespace, conrelid, conkey, pg_get_constraintdef(oid) As consrc FROM pg_constraint) AS s WHERE n.nspname = $1 AND c.relname = $2 AND a.attname = $3 AND a.attrelid = c.oid AND s.connamespace = n.oid AND s.conrelid = c.oid AND a.attnum = ANY (s.conkey) AND s.consrc LIKE '%st_' || $4 || '(%= %';

routine.name: _raster_constraint_info_coverage_tile(rastschema name, rasttable name, rastcolumn name)
routine.definition: SELECT TRUE FROM pg_class c, pg_namespace n, pg_attribute a , (SELECT connamespace, conrelid, conkey, pg_get_constraintdef(oid) As consrc FROM pg_constraint) AS s WHERE n.nspname = $1 AND c.relname = $2 AND a.attname = $3 AND a.attrelid = c.oid AND s.connamespace = n.oid AND s.conrelid = c.oid AND a.attnum = ANY (s.conkey) AND s.consrc LIKE '%st_iscoveragetile(%';

routine.name: _raster_constraint_info_extent(rastschema name, rasttable name, rastcolumn name)
routine.definition: SELECT trim(both '''' from split_part(trim(split_part(s.consrc, ' @ ', 2)), '::', 1))::public.geometry FROM pg_class c, pg_namespace n, pg_attribute a , (SELECT connamespace, conrelid, conkey, pg_get_constraintdef(oid) As consrc FROM pg_constraint) AS s WHERE n.nspname = $1 AND c.relname = $2 AND a.attname = $3 AND a.attrelid = c.oid AND s.connamespace = n.oid AND s.conrelid = c.oid AND a.attnum = ANY (s.conkey) AND s.consrc LIKE '%st_envelope(% @ %';

routine.name: _raster_constraint_info_index(rastschema name, rasttable name, rastcolumn name)
routine.definition: SELECT TRUE FROM pg_catalog.pg_class c JOIN pg_catalog.pg_index i ON i.indexrelid = c.oid JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class c2 ON i.indrelid = c2.oid JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace n ON n.oid = c.relnamespace JOIN pg_am am ON c.relam = am.oid JOIN pg_attribute att ON att.attrelid = c2.oid AND pg_catalog.format_type(att.atttypid, att.atttypmod) = 'raster' WHERE c.relkind IN ('i') AND n.nspname = $1 AND c2.relname = $2 AND att.attname = $3 AND am.amname = 'gist' AND strpos(pg_catalog.pg_get_expr(i.indexprs, i.indrelid), att.attname) > 0;

routine.name: _raster_constraint_info_nodata_values(rastschema name, rasttable name, rastcolumn name)
routine.definition: SELECT trim(both '''' from split_part( regexp_replace( split_part(s.consrc, ' = ', 2), '[\(\)]', '', 'g' ), '::', 1 ) )::double precision[] FROM pg_class c, pg_namespace n, pg_attribute a , (SELECT connamespace, conrelid, conkey, pg_get_constraintdef(oid) As consrc FROM pg_constraint) AS s WHERE n.nspname = $1 AND c.relname = $2 AND a.attname = $3 AND a.attrelid = c.oid AND s.connamespace = n.oid AND s.conrelid = c.oid AND a.attnum = ANY (s.conkey) AND s.consrc LIKE '%_raster_constraint_nodata_values(%';

routine.name: _raster_constraint_info_num_bands(rastschema name, rasttable name, rastcolumn name)
routine.definition: SELECT regexp_replace( split_part(s.consrc, ' = ', 2), '[\(\)]', '', 'g' )::integer FROM pg_class c, pg_namespace n, pg_attribute a , (SELECT connamespace, conrelid, conkey, pg_get_constraintdef(oid) As consrc FROM pg_constraint) AS s WHERE n.nspname = $1 AND c.relname = $2 AND a.attname = $3 AND a.attrelid = c.oid AND s.connamespace = n.oid AND s.conrelid = c.oid AND a.attnum = ANY (s.conkey) AND s.consrc LIKE '%st_numbands(%';

routine.name: _raster_constraint_info_out_db(rastschema name, rasttable name, rastcolumn name)
routine.definition: SELECT trim( both '''' from split_part( regexp_replace( split_part(s.consrc, ' = ', 2), '[\(\)]', '', 'g' ), '::', 1 ) )::boolean[] FROM pg_class c, pg_namespace n, pg_attribute a , (SELECT connamespace, conrelid, conkey, pg_get_constraintdef(oid) As consrc FROM pg_constraint) AS s WHERE n.nspname = $1 AND c.relname = $2 AND a.attname = $3 AND a.attrelid = c.oid AND s.connamespace = n.oid AND s.conrelid = c.oid AND a.attnum = ANY (s.conkey) AND s.consrc LIKE '%_raster_constraint_out_db(%';

routine.name: _raster_constraint_info_pixel_types(rastschema name, rasttable name, rastcolumn name)
routine.definition: SELECT trim( both '''' from split_part( regexp_replace( split_part(s.consrc, ' = ', 2), '[\(\)]', '', 'g' ), '::', 1 ) )::text[] FROM pg_class c, pg_namespace n, pg_attribute a , (SELECT connamespace, conrelid, conkey, pg_get_constraintdef(oid) As consrc FROM pg_constraint) AS s WHERE n.nspname = $1 AND c.relname = $2 AND a.attname = $3 AND a.attrelid = c.oid AND s.connamespace = n.oid AND s.conrelid = c.oid AND a.attnum = ANY (s.conkey) AND s.consrc LIKE '%_raster_constraint_pixel_types(%';

routine.name: _raster_constraint_info_regular_blocking(rastschema name, rasttable name, rastcolumn name)
_raster_constraint_info_scale(rastschema name, rasttable name, rastcolumn name, axis character)
routine.definition: WITH c AS (SELECT regexp_replace( replace( split_part( split_part(s.consrc, ' = ', 2), '::', 1 ), 'round(', '' ), '[ ''''\(\)]', '', 'g' )::text AS val FROM pg_class c, pg_namespace n, pg_attribute a , (SELECT connamespace, conrelid, conkey, pg_get_constraintdef(oid) As consrc FROM pg_constraint) AS s WHERE n.nspname = $1 AND c.relname = $2 AND a.attname = $3 AND a.attrelid = c.oid AND s.connamespace = n.oid AND s.conrelid = c.oid AND a.attnum = ANY (s.conkey) AND s.consrc LIKE '%st_scale' || $4 || '(% = %') -- if it is a comma separated list of two numbers then need to use round SELECT CASE WHEN split_part(c.val,',', 2) > '' THEN round( split_part(c.val, ',',1)::numeric, split_part(c.val,',',2)::integer )::float8 ELSE c.val::float8 END FROM c;

routine.name: _raster_constraint_info_spatially_unique(rastschema name, rasttable name, rastcolumn name)
routine.definition: SELECT TRUE FROM pg_class c, pg_namespace n, pg_attribute a , (SELECT connamespace, conrelid, conindid, conkey, contype, conexclop, pg_get_constraintdef(oid) As consrc FROM pg_constraint) AS s , pg_index idx, pg_operator op WHERE n.nspname = $1 AND c.relname = $2 AND a.attname = $3 AND a.attrelid = c.oid AND s.connamespace = n.oid AND s.conrelid = c.oid AND s.contype = 'x' AND 0::smallint = ANY (s.conkey) AND idx.indexrelid = s.conindid AND pg_get_indexdef(idx.indexrelid, 1, true) LIKE '(' || quote_ident($3) || '::%geometry)' AND s.conexclop[1] = op.oid AND op.oprname = '=';

routine.name: _raster_constraint_info_srid(rastschema name, rasttable name, rastcolumn name)
routine.definition: SELECT regexp_replace( split_part(s.consrc, ' = ', 2), '[\(\)]', '', 'g' )::integer FROM pg_class c, pg_namespace n, pg_attribute a , (SELECT connamespace, conrelid, conkey, pg_get_constraintdef(oid) As consrc FROM pg_constraint) AS s WHERE n.nspname = $1 AND c.relname = $2 AND a.attname = $3 AND a.attrelid = c.oid AND s.connamespace = n.oid AND s.conrelid = c.oid AND a.attnum = ANY (s.conkey) AND s.consrc LIKE '%st_srid(% = %';

routine.name: postgis_constraint_dims(geomschema text, geomtable text, geomcolumn text)
routine.definition:
SELECT replace(split_part(s.consrc, ' = ', 2), ')', '')::integer
FROM pg_class c, pg_namespace n, pg_attribute a , (SELECT connamespace, conrelid, conkey, pg_get_constraintdef(oid) As consrc FROM pg_constraint) AS s WHERE n.nspname = $1 AND c.relname = $2 AND a.attname = $3 AND a.attrelid = c.oid AND s.connamespace = n.oid AND s.conrelid = c.oid AND a.attnum = ANY (s.conkey) AND s.consrc LIKE '%ndims(% = %';

routine.name: postgis_constraint_srid(geomschema text, geomtable text, geomcolumn text)
routine.definition: SELECT replace(replace(split_part(s.consrc, ' = ', 2), ')', ''), '(', '')::integer FROM pg_class c, pg_namespace n, pg_attribute a , (SELECT connamespace, conrelid, conkey, pg_get_constraintdef(oid) As consrc FROM pg_constraint) AS s WHERE n.nspname = $1 AND c.relname = $2 AND a.attname = $3 AND a.attrelid = c.oid AND s.connamespace = n.oid AND s.conrelid = c.oid AND a.attnum = ANY (s.conkey) AND s.consrc LIKE '%srid(% = %';

routine.name: postgis_constraint_type(geomschema text, geomtable text, geomcolumn text)
routine.definition:
SELECT replace(split_part(s.consrc, '''', 2), ')', '')::varchar
FROM pg_class c, pg_namespace n, pg_attribute a , (SELECT connamespace, conrelid, conkey, pg_get_constraintdef(oid) As consrc FROM pg_constraint) AS s WHERE n.nspname = $1 AND c.relname = $2 AND a.attname = $3 AND a.attrelid = c.oid AND s.connamespace = n.oid AND s.conrelid = c.oid AND a.attnum = ANY (s.conkey) AND s.consrc LIKE '%geometrytype(% = %';

routine.name: postgis_type_name(geomname character varying, coord_dimension integer, use_new_name boolean DEFAULT true)
routine.definition:
SELECT CASE WHEN $3 THEN new_name ELSE old_name END As geomname FROM ( VALUES ('GEOMETRY', 'Geometry', 2), ('GEOMETRY', 'GeometryZ', 3), ('GEOMETRYM', 'GeometryM', 3), ('GEOMETRY', 'GeometryZM', 4),
('GEOMETRYCOLLECTION', 'GeometryCollection', 2), ('GEOMETRYCOLLECTION', 'GeometryCollectionZ', 3), ('GEOMETRYCOLLECTIONM', 'GeometryCollectionM', 3), ('GEOMETRYCOLLECTION', 'GeometryCollectionZM', 4),
('POINT', 'Point', 2), ('POINT', 'PointZ', 3), ('POINTM','PointM', 3), ('POINT', 'PointZM', 4),
('MULTIPOINT','MultiPoint', 2), ('MULTIPOINT','MultiPointZ', 3), ('MULTIPOINTM','MultiPointM', 3), ('MULTIPOINT','MultiPointZM', 4),
('POLYGON', 'Polygon', 2), ('POLYGON', 'PolygonZ', 3), ('POLYGONM', 'PolygonM', 3), ('POLYGON', 'PolygonZM', 4),
('MULTIPOLYGON', 'MultiPolygon', 2), ('MULTIPOLYGON', 'MultiPolygonZ', 3), ('MULTIPOLYGONM', 'MultiPolygonM', 3), ('MULTIPOLYGON', 'MultiPolygonZM', 4),
('MULTILINESTRING', 'MultiLineString', 2), ('MULTILINESTRING', 'MultiLineStringZ', 3), ('MULTILINESTRINGM', 'MultiLineStringM', 3), ('MULTILINESTRING', 'MultiLineStringZM', 4),
('LINESTRING', 'LineString', 2), ('LINESTRING', 'LineStringZ', 3), ('LINESTRINGM', 'LineStringM', 3), ('LINESTRING', 'LineStringZM', 4),
('CIRCULARSTRING', 'CircularString', 2), ('CIRCULARSTRING', 'CircularStringZ', 3), ('CIRCULARSTRINGM', 'CircularStringM' ,3), ('CIRCULARSTRING', 'CircularStringZM', 4),
('COMPOUNDCURVE', 'CompoundCurve', 2), ('COMPOUNDCURVE', 'CompoundCurveZ', 3), ('COMPOUNDCURVEM', 'CompoundCurveM', 3), ('COMPOUNDCURVE', 'CompoundCurveZM', 4),
('CURVEPOLYGON', 'CurvePolygon', 2), ('CURVEPOLYGON', 'CurvePolygonZ', 3), ('CURVEPOLYGONM', 'CurvePolygonM', 3), ('CURVEPOLYGON', 'CurvePolygonZM', 4),
('MULTICURVE', 'MultiCurve', 2), ('MULTICURVE', 'MultiCurveZ', 3), ('MULTICURVEM', 'MultiCurveM', 3), ('MULTICURVE', 'MultiCurveZM', 4),
('MULTISURFACE', 'MultiSurface', 2), ('MULTISURFACE', 'MultiSurfaceZ', 3), ('MULTISURFACEM', 'MultiSurfaceM', 3), ('MULTISURFACE', 'MultiSurfaceZM', 4),
('POLYHEDRALSURFACE', 'PolyhedralSurface', 2), ('POLYHEDRALSURFACE', 'PolyhedralSurfaceZ', 3), ('POLYHEDRALSURFACEM', 'PolyhedralSurfaceM', 3), ('POLYHEDRALSURFACE', 'PolyhedralSurfaceZM', 4),
('TRIANGLE', 'Triangle', 2), ('TRIANGLE', 'TriangleZ', 3), ('TRIANGLEM', 'TriangleM', 3), ('TRIANGLE', 'TriangleZM', 4),
('TIN', 'Tin', 2), ('TIN', 'TinZ', 3), ('TINM', 'TinM', 3), ('TIN', 'TinZM', 4) ) As g(old_name, new_name, coord_dimension) WHERE (upper(old_name) = upper($1) OR upper(new_name) = upper($1)) AND coord_dimension = $2;

routine.name: regexp_match(citext, citext, text)
routine.definition: SELECT pg_catalog.regexp_match( $1::pg_catalog.text, $2::pg_catalog.text, CASE WHEN pg_catalog.strpos($3, 'c') = 0 THEN $3 || 'i' ELSE $3 END );

routine.definition: SELECT pg_catalog.regexp_replace( $1::pg_catalog.text, $2::pg_catalog.text, $3, CASE WHEN pg_catalog.strpos($4, 'c') = 0 THEN $4 || 'i' ELSE $4 END);

routine.name: regexp_split_to_array(citext, citext, text)
routine.definition: SELECT pg_catalog.regexp_split_to_array( $1::pg_catalog.text, $2::pg_catalog.text, CASE WHEN pg_catalog.strpos($3, 'c') = 0 THEN $3 || 'i' ELSE $3 END );

routine.name: regexp_split_to_table(citext, citext, text)
routine.definition: SELECT pg_catalog.regexp_split_to_table( $1::pg_catalog.text, $2::pg_catalog.text, CASE WHEN pg_catalog.strpos($3, 'c') = 0 THEN $3 || 'i' ELSE $3 END );

st_3dclosestpoint(geom1 geometry, geom2 geometry)
routine.comment: args: g1, g2 - Returns the 3-dimensional point on g1 that is closest to g2. This is the first point of the 3D shortest line.

routine.name: st_3ddfullywithin(geom1 geometry, geom2 geometry, double precision)
routine.comment: args: g1, g2, distance - Returns true if all of the 3D geometries are within the specified distance of one another.
routine.definition: SELECT $1 OPERATOR(public.&&) public.ST_Expand($2,$3) AND $2 OPERATOR(public.&&) public.ST_Expand($1,$3) AND public._ST_3DDFullyWithin($1, $2, $3)

routine.name: st_3ddistance(geom1 geometry, geom2 geometry)
routine.comment: args: g1, g2 - For geometry type Returns the 3-dimensional cartesian minimum distance (based on spatial ref) between two geometries in projected units.

routine.name: st_3ddwithin(geom1 geometry, geom2 geometry, double precision)
routine.comment: args: g1, g2, distance_of_srid - For 3d (z) geometry type Returns true if two geometries 3d distance is within number of units.
routine.definition: SELECT $1 OPERATOR(public.&&) public.ST_Expand($2,$3) AND $2 OPERATOR(public.&&) public.ST_Expand($1,$3) AND public._ST_3DDWithin($1, $2, $3)

routine.name: st_3dextent(geometry)
routine.comment: args: geomfield - an aggregate function that returns the box3D bounding box that bounds rows of geometries.

routine.name: st_3dintersects(geom1 geometry, geom2 geometry)
routine.comment: args: geomA, geomB - Returns TRUE if the Geometries "spatially intersect" in 3d - only for points, linestrings, polygons, polyhedral surface (area). With SFCGAL backend enabled also supports TINS

routine.name: st_3dlength(geometry)
routine.comment: args: a_3dlinestring - Returns the 3-dimensional or 2-dimensional length of the geometry if it is a linestring or multi-linestring.

routine.name: st_3dlongestline(geom1 geometry, geom2 geometry)
routine.comment: args: g1, g2 - Returns the 3-dimensional longest line between two geometries

routine.name: st_3dmakebox(geom1 geometry, geom2 geometry)
routine.comment: args: point3DLowLeftBottom, point3DUpRightTop - Creates a BOX3D defined by the given 3d point geometries.

routine.name: st_3dmaxdistance(geom1 geometry, geom2 geometry)
routine.comment: args: g1, g2 - For geometry type Returns the 3-dimensional cartesian maximum distance (based on spatial ref) between two geometries in projected units.

routine.comment: args: geog, use_spheroid=true - Returns the area of the surface if it is a Polygon or MultiPolygon. For geometry, a 2D Cartesian area is determined with units specified by the SRID. For geography, area is determined on a curved surface with units in square meters.

routine.comment: args: rast, nband, compression - Return the raster tile selected bands as a single portable network graphics (PNG) image (byte array). If 1, 3, or 4 bands in raster and no bands are specified, then all bands are used. If more 2 or more than 4 bands and no bands specified, then only band 1 is used. Bands are mapped to RGB or RGBA space.

routine.name: st_astiff(rast raster, options text[] DEFAULT NULL::text[], srid integer DEFAULT NULL::integer)

routine.name: st_astwkb(geom geometry[], ids bigint[], prec integer DEFAULT NULL::integer, prec_z integer DEFAULT NULL::integer, prec_m integer DEFAULT NULL::integer, with_sizes boolean DEFAULT NULL::boolean, with_boxes boolean DEFAULT NULL::boolean)

routine.name: st_aswkb(raster, outasin boolean DEFAULT false)

routine.name: st_asx3d(geom geometry, maxdecimaldigits integer DEFAULT 15, options integer DEFAULT 0)
routine.comment: args: g1, maxdecimaldigits=15, options=0 - Returns a Geometry in X3D xml node element format: ISO-IEC-19776-1.2-X3DEncodings-XML

routine.name: st_azimuth(geog1 geography, geog2 geography)
routine.comment: args: pointA, pointB - Returns the north-based azimuth as the angle in radians measured clockwise from the vertical on pointA to pointB.

routine.name: st_azimuth(geom1 geometry, geom2 geometry)
routine.comment: args: pointA, pointB - Returns the north-based azimuth as the angle in radians measured clockwise from the vertical on pointA to pointB.

routine.name: st_band(rast raster, nband integer)
routine.comment: args: rast, nband - Returns one or more bands of an existing raster as a new raster. Useful for building new rasters from existing rasters.

routine.name: st_band(rast raster, nbands integer[] DEFAULT ARRAY[1])
routine.comment: args: rast, nbands = ARRAY[1] - Returns one or more bands of an existing raster as a new raster. Useful for building new rasters from existing rasters.

routine.name: st_band(rast raster, nbands text, delimiter character DEFAULT ','::bpchar)
routine.comment: args: rast, nbands, delimiter=, - Returns one or more bands of an existing raster as a new raster. Useful for building new rasters from existing rasters.
routine.definition: SELECT public.ST_band($1, regexp_split_to_array(regexp_replace($2, '[[:space:]]', '', 'g'), E'\\' || array_to_string(regexp_split_to_array($3, ''), E'\\'))::int[])

routine.name: st_bandfilesize(rast raster, band integer DEFAULT 1)
routine.comment: args: rast, bandnum=1 - Returns the file size of a band stored in file system. If no bandnum specified, 1 is assumed.

routine.name: st_bandfiletimestamp(rast raster, band integer DEFAULT 1)
routine.comment: args: rast, bandnum=1 - Returns the file timestamp of a band stored in file system. If no bandnum specified, 1 is assumed.

routine.name: st_bandisnodata(rast raster, band integer DEFAULT 1, forcechecking boolean DEFAULT false)
routine.comment: args: rast, band, forceChecking=true - Returns true if the band is filled with only nodata values.

routine.name: st_bandisnodata(rast raster, forcechecking boolean)
routine.comment: args: rast, forceChecking=true - Returns true if the band is filled with only nodata values.

routine.name: st_bandmetadata(rast raster, band integer DEFAULT 1, OUT pixeltype text, OUT nodatavalue double precision, OUT isoutdb boolean, OUT path text, OUT outdbbandnum integer, OUT filesize bigint, OUT filetimestamp bigint)
routine.comment: args: rast, band=1 - Returns basic meta data for a specific raster band. band num 1 is assumed if none-specified.
routine.definition: SELECT pixeltype, nodatavalue, isoutdb, path, outdbbandnum, filesize, filetimestamp FROM public.ST_BandMetaData($1, ARRAY[$2]::int[]) LIMIT 1

routine.name: st_bandmetadata(rast raster, band integer[], OUT bandnum integer, OUT pixeltype text, OUT nodatavalue double precision, OUT isoutdb boolean, OUT path text, OUT outdbbandnum integer, OUT filesize bigint, OUT filetimestamp bigint)
routine.comment: args: rast, band - Returns basic meta data for a specific raster band. band num 1 is assumed if none-specified.

routine.name: st_bandnodatavalue(rast raster, band integer DEFAULT 1)
routine.comment: args: rast, bandnum=1 - Returns the value in a given band that represents no data. If no band num 1 is assumed.

routine.name: st_bandpath(rast raster, band integer DEFAULT 1)
routine.comment: args: rast, bandnum=1 - Returns system file path to a band stored in file system. If no bandnum specified, 1 is assumed.

routine.name: st_bandpixeltype(rast raster, band integer DEFAULT 1)
routine.comment: args: rast, bandnum=1 - Returns the type of pixel for given band. If no bandnum specified, 1 is assumed.

routine.comment: args: WKT, srid - Construct a Polygon given an arbitrary collection of closed linestrings as a MultiLineString Well-Known text representation.

routine.comment: args: geomA - Returns the closure of the combinatorial boundary of this Geometry.

routine.comment: args: geohash, precision=full_precision_of_geohash - Return a BOX2D from a GeoHash string.

routine.name: st_buffer(geography, double precision)
routine.comment: args: g1, radius_of_buffer_in_meters - (T)Returns a geometry covering all points within a given distancefrom the input geometry.

routine.name: st_buffer(geography, double precision, integer)
routine.comment: args: g1, radius_of_buffer, num_seg_quarter_circle - (T)Returns a geometry covering all points within a given distancefrom the input geometry.

routine.name: st_buffer(geography, double precision, text)
routine.comment: args: g1, radius_of_buffer, buffer_style_parameters - (T)Returns a geometry covering all points within a given distancefrom the input geometry.

routine.name: st_buffer(geometry, double precision)
routine.comment: args: g1, radius_of_buffer - (T)Returns a geometry covering all points within a given distancefrom the input geometry.

routine.name: st_buffer(geometry, double precision, integer)
routine.comment: args: g1, radius_of_buffer, num_seg_quarter_circle - (T)Returns a geometry covering all points within a given distancefrom the input geometry.
routine.definition: SELECT public._ST_Buffer($1, $2, CAST('quad_segs='||CAST($3 AS text) as cstring))

routine.name: st_buffer(geometry, double precision, text)
routine.comment: args: g1, radius_of_buffer, buffer_style_parameters - (T)Returns a geometry covering all points within a given distancefrom the input geometry.
routine.definition: SELECT public._ST_Buffer($1, $2, CAST( regexp_replace($3, '^[0123456789]+$', 'quad_segs='||$3) AS cstring) )

routine.name: st_buildarea(geometry)
routine.comment: args: A - Creates an areal geometry formed by the constituent linework of given geometry

routine.name: st_clusterintersecting(geometry)
routine.comment: args: g - Aggregate. Returns an array with the connected components of a set of geometries

routine.name: st_clusterwithin(geometry, double precision)
routine.comment: args: g, distance - Aggregate. Returns an array of GeometryCollections, where each GeometryCollection represents a set of geometries separated by no more than the specified distance.

routine.comment: args: collection - Given a geometry collection, return the "simplest" representation of the contents.

routine.name: st_colormap(rast raster, colormap text, method text DEFAULT 'INTERPOLATE'::text)
st_colormap(rast raster, nband integer DEFAULT 1, colormap text DEFAULT 'grayscale'::text, method text DEFAULT 'INTERPOLATE'::text)
st_concavehull(param_geom geometry, param_pctconvex double precision, param_allow_holes boolean DEFAULT false)
routine.comment: args: geomA, target_percent, allow_holes=false - The concave hull of a geometry represents a possibly concave geometry that encloses all geometries within the set. You can think of it as shrink wrapping.

routine.name: st_contains(geom1 geometry, geom2 geometry)
routine.comment: args: geomA, geomB - Returns true if and only if no points of B lie in the exterior of A, and at least one point of the interior of B lies in the interior of A.

routine.name: st_contains(rast1 raster, nband1 integer, rast2 raster, nband2 integer)
routine.comment: args: rastA, nbandA, rastB, nbandB - Return true if no points of raster rastB lie in the exterior of raster rastA and at least one point of the interior of rastB lies in the interior of rastA.
routine.definition: SELECT $1 OPERATOR(public.&&) $3 AND CASE WHEN $2 IS NULL OR $4 IS NULL THEN public._st_contains(public.st_convexhull($1), public.st_convexhull($3)) ELSE public._st_contains($1, $2, $3, $4) END

routine.name: st_contains(rast1 raster, rast2 raster)
routine.comment: args: rastA, rastB - Return true if no points of raster rastB lie in the exterior of raster rastA and at least one point of the interior of rastB lies in the interior of rastA.

routine.name: st_containsproperly(geom1 geometry, geom2 geometry)
routine.comment: args: geomA, geomB - Returns true if B intersects the interior of A but not the boundary (or exterior). A does not contain properly itself, but does contain itself.

routine.name: st_containsproperly(rast1 raster, nband1 integer, rast2 raster, nband2 integer)
routine.comment: args: rastA, nbandA, rastB, nbandB - Return true if rastB intersects the interior of rastA but not the boundary or exterior of rastA.
routine.definition: SELECT $1 OPERATOR(public.&&) $3 AND CASE WHEN $2 IS NULL OR $4 IS NULL THEN public._st_containsproperly(public.st_convexhull($1), public.st_convexhull($3)) ELSE public._st_containsproperly($1, $2, $3, $4) END

routine.name: st_containsproperly(rast1 raster, rast2 raster)
routine.comment: args: rastA, rastB - Return true if rastB intersects the interior of rastA but not the boundary or exterior of rastA.

routine.name: st_convexhull(geometry)
routine.comment: args: geomA - The convex hull of a geometry represents the minimum convex geometry that encloses all geometries within the set.

routine.name: st_coorddim(geometry geometry)
routine.comment: args: geomA - Return the coordinate dimension of the ST_Geometry value.

routine.name: st_count(rast raster, exclude_nodata_value boolean)
routine.comment: args: rast, exclude_nodata_value - Returns the number of pixels in a given band of a raster or raster coverage. If no band is specified defaults to band 1. If exclude_nodata_value is set to true, will only count pixels that are not equal to the nodata value.

routine.name: st_count(rast raster, nband integer DEFAULT 1, exclude_nodata_value boolean DEFAULT true)
routine.comment: args: rast, nband=1, exclude_nodata_value=true - Returns the number of pixels in a given band of a raster or raster coverage. If no band is specified defaults to band 1. If exclude_nodata_value is set to true, will only count pixels that are not equal to the nodata value.

routine.name: st_count(rastertable text, rastercolumn text, exclude_nodata_value boolean)
routine.comment: args: rastertable, rastercolumn, exclude_nodata_value - Returns the number of pixels in a given band of a raster or raster coverage. If no band is specified defaults to band 1. If exclude_nodata_value is set to true, will only count pixels that are not equal to the nodata value.

routine.name: st_count(rastertable text, rastercolumn text, nband integer DEFAULT 1, exclude_nodata_value boolean DEFAULT true)
routine.comment: args: rastertable, rastercolumn, nband=1, exclude_nodata_value=true - Returns the number of pixels in a given band of a raster or raster coverage. If no band is specified defaults to band 1. If exclude_nodata_value is set to true, will only count pixels that are not equal to the nodata value.

routine.name: st_countagg(raster, boolean)
routine.comment: args: rast, exclude_nodata_value - Aggregate. Returns the number of pixels in a given band of a set of rasters. If no band is specified defaults to band 1. If exclude_nodata_value is set to true, will only count pixels that are not equal to the NODATA value.

routine.name: st_countagg(raster, integer, boolean)
routine.comment: args: rast, nband, exclude_nodata_value - Aggregate. Returns the number of pixels in a given band of a set of rasters. If no band is specified defaults to band 1. If exclude_nodata_value is set to true, will only count pixels that are not equal to the NODATA value.

routine.name: st_countagg(raster, integer, boolean, double precision)
routine.comment: args: rast, nband, exclude_nodata_value, sample_percent - Aggregate. Returns the number of pixels in a given band of a set of rasters. If no band is specified defaults to band 1. If exclude_nodata_value is set to true, will only count pixels that are not equal to the NODATA value.

routine.name: st_coveredby(geography, geography)
routine.comment: args: geogA, geogB - Returns 1 (TRUE) if no point in Geometry/Geography A is outside Geometry/Geography B

routine.name: st_coveredby(geom1 geometry, geom2 geometry)
routine.comment: args: geomA, geomB - Returns 1 (TRUE) if no point in Geometry/Geography A is outside Geometry/Geography B

routine.name: st_coveredby(rast1 raster, nband1 integer, rast2 raster, nband2 integer)
routine.comment: args: rastA, nbandA, rastB, nbandB - Return true if no points of raster rastA lie outside raster rastB.
routine.definition: SELECT $1 OPERATOR(public.&&) $3 AND CASE WHEN $2 IS NULL OR $4 IS NULL THEN public._st_coveredby(public.st_convexhull($1), public.st_convexhull($3)) ELSE public._st_coveredby($1, $2, $3, $4) END

routine.name: st_coveredby(rast1 raster, rast2 raster)
routine.comment: args: rastA, rastB - Return true if no points of raster rastA lie outside raster rastB.

routine.name: st_covers(geography, geography)
routine.comment: args: geogpolyA, geogpointB - Returns 1 (TRUE) if no point in Geometry B is outside Geometry A

routine.name: st_covers(geom1 geometry, geom2 geometry)
routine.comment: args: geomA, geomB - Returns 1 (TRUE) if no point in Geometry B is outside Geometry A

routine.name: st_covers(rast1 raster, nband1 integer, rast2 raster, nband2 integer)
routine.comment: args: rastA, nbandA, rastB, nbandB - Return true if no points of raster rastB lie outside raster rastA.
routine.definition: SELECT $1 OPERATOR(public.&&) $3 AND CASE WHEN $2 IS NULL OR $4 IS NULL THEN public._st_covers(public.st_convexhull($1), public.st_convexhull($3)) ELSE public._st_covers($1, $2, $3, $4) END

routine.name: st_covers(rast1 raster, rast2 raster)
routine.comment: args: rastA, rastB - Return true if no points of raster rastB lie outside raster rastA.

routine.name: st_cpawithin(geometry, geometry, double precision)
routine.comment: args: track1, track2, maxdist - Returns true if the trajectories closest points of approachare within the specified distance.

routine.name: st_createoverview(tab regclass, col name, factor integer, algo text DEFAULT 'NearestNeighbour'::text)
routine.comment: args: tab, col, factor, algo='NearestNeighbor' - Create an reduced resolution version of a given raster coverage.

routine.name: st_crosses(geom1 geometry, geom2 geometry)
routine.comment: args: g1, g2 - Returns TRUE if the supplied geometries have some, but not all, interior points in common.

routine.name: st_curvetoline(geom geometry, tol double precision DEFAULT 32, toltype integer DEFAULT 0, flags integer DEFAULT 0)
routine.comment: args: curveGeom, tolerance, tolerance_type, flags - Converts a CIRCULARSTRING/CURVEPOLYGON/MULTISURFACE to a LINESTRING/POLYGON/MULTIPOLYGON

routine.name: st_delaunaytriangles(g1 geometry, tolerance double precision DEFAULT 0.0, flags integer DEFAULT 0)
routine.comment: args: g1, tolerance, flags - Return a Delaunay triangulation around the given input points.

routine.name: st_dfullywithin(geom1 geometry, geom2 geometry, double precision)
routine.comment: args: g1, g2, distance - Returns true if all of the geometries are within the specified distance of one another
routine.definition: SELECT $1 OPERATOR(public.&&) public.ST_Expand($2,$3) AND $2 OPERATOR(public.&&) public.ST_Expand($1,$3) AND public._ST_DFullyWithin(public.ST_ConvexHull($1), public.ST_ConvexHull($2), $3)

routine.name: st_dfullywithin(rast1 raster, nband1 integer, rast2 raster, nband2 integer, distance double precision)
routine.comment: args: rastA, nbandA, rastB, nbandB, distance_of_srid - Return true if rasters rastA and rastB are fully within the specified distance of each other.
routine.definition: SELECT $1::public.geometry OPERATOR(public.&&) public.ST_Expand(public.ST_ConvexHull($3), $5) AND $3::public.geometry OPERATOR(public.&&) public.ST_Expand(public.ST_ConvexHull($1), $5) AND CASE WHEN $2 IS NULL OR $4 IS NULL THEN public._ST_DFullyWithin(public.ST_ConvexHull($1), public.ST_Convexhull($3), $5) ELSE public._ST_DFullyWithin($1, $2, $3, $4, $5) END

routine.name: st_dfullywithin(rast1 raster, rast2 raster, distance double precision)
routine.comment: args: rastA, rastB, distance_of_srid - Return true if rasters rastA and rastB are fully within the specified distance of each other.

routine.name: st_difference(geom1 geometry, geom2 geometry)
routine.comment: args: geomA, geomB - Returns a geometry that represents that part of geometry A that does not intersect with geometry B.

routine.name: st_dimension(geometry)
routine.comment: args: g - The inherent dimension of this Geometry object, which must be less than or equal to the coordinate dimension.

routine.name: st_disjoint(geom1 geometry, geom2 geometry)
routine.comment: args: A, B - Returns TRUE if the Geometries do not "spatially intersect" - if they do not share any space together.

routine.name: st_disjoint(rast1 raster, nband1 integer, rast2 raster, nband2 integer)
routine.comment: args: rastA, nbandA, rastB, nbandB - Return true if raster rastA does not spatially intersect rastB.
routine.definition: SELECT CASE WHEN $2 IS NULL OR $4 IS NULL THEN public.ST_Disjoint(public.ST_ConvexHull($1), public.ST_ConvexHull($3)) ELSE NOT public._ST_intersects($1, $2, $3, $4) END

routine.name: st_disjoint(rast1 raster, rast2 raster)
routine.comment: args: rastA, rastB - Return true if raster rastA does not spatially intersect rastB.

routine.name: st_distance(geography, geography)
routine.comment: args: gg1, gg2 - For geometry type returns the 2D Cartesian distance between two geometries in projected units (based on spatial reference system). For geography type defaults to return minimum geodesic distance between two geographies in meters.

routine.name: st_distance(geography, geography, boolean)
routine.comment: args: gg1, gg2, use_spheroid - For geometry type returns the 2D Cartesian distance between two geometries in projected units (based on spatial reference system). For geography type defaults to return minimum geodesic distance between two geographies in meters.

routine.name: st_distance(geom1 geometry, geom2 geometry)
routine.comment: args: g1, g2 - For geometry type returns the 2D Cartesian distance between two geometries in projected units (based on spatial reference system). For geography type defaults to return minimum geodesic distance between two geographies in meters.

routine.name: st_distancecpa(geometry, geometry)
routine.comment: args: track1, track2 - Returns the distance between closest points of approach in two trajectories.

routine.name: st_distancesphere(geom1 geometry, geom2 geometry)
routine.comment: args: geomlonlatA, geomlonlatB - Returns minimum distance in meters between two lon/lat geometries. Uses a spherical earth and radius derived from the spheroid defined by the SRID. Faster than ST_DistanceSpheroid , but less accurate. PostGIS versions prior to 1.5 only implemented for points.

routine.name: st_distancespheroid(geom1 geometry, geom2 geometry, spheroid)
routine.comment: args: geomlonlatA, geomlonlatB, measurement_spheroid - Returns the minimum distance between two lon/lat geometries given a particular spheroid. PostGIS versions prior to 1.5 only support points.

st_distinct4ma(value double precision[], pos integer[], VARIADIC userargs text[] DEFAULT NULL::text[])
routine.definition: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT unnest)::double precision FROM unnest($1)

routine.name: st_dwithin(geography, geography, double precision)
routine.comment: args: gg1, gg2, distance_meters - Returns true if the geometries are within the specified distance of one another. For geometry units are in those of spatial reference and for geography units are in meters and measurement is defaulted to use_spheroid=true (measure around spheroid), for faster check, use_spheroid=false to measure along sphere.
routine.definition: SELECT $1 OPERATOR(public.&&) public._ST_Expand($2,$3) AND $2 OPERATOR(public.&&) public._ST_Expand($1,$3) AND public._ST_DWithin($1, $2, $3, true)

routine.name: st_dwithin(geography, geography, double precision, boolean)
routine.comment: args: gg1, gg2, distance_meters, use_spheroid - Returns true if the geometries are within the specified distance of one another. For geometry units are in those of spatial reference and for geography units are in meters and measurement is defaulted to use_spheroid=true (measure around spheroid), for faster check, use_spheroid=false to measure along sphere.
routine.definition: SELECT $1 OPERATOR(public.&&) public._ST_Expand($2,$3) AND $2 OPERATOR(public.&&) public._ST_Expand($1,$3) AND public._ST_DWithin($1, $2, $3, $4)

routine.name: st_dwithin(geom1 geometry, geom2 geometry, double precision)
routine.comment: args: g1, g2, distance_of_srid - Returns true if the geometries are within the specified distance of one another. For geometry units are in those of spatial reference and for geography units are in meters and measurement is defaulted to use_spheroid=true (measure around spheroid), for faster check, use_spheroid=false to measure along sphere.
routine.definition: SELECT $1 OPERATOR(public.&&) public.ST_Expand($2,$3) AND $2 OPERATOR(public.&&) public.ST_Expand($1,$3) AND public._ST_DWithin($1, $2, $3)

routine.name: st_dwithin(rast1 raster, nband1 integer, rast2 raster, nband2 integer, distance double precision)
routine.comment: args: rastA, nbandA, rastB, nbandB, distance_of_srid - Return true if rasters rastA and rastB are within the specified distance of each other.
routine.definition: SELECT $1::public.geometry OPERATOR(public.&&) public.ST_Expand(public.ST_ConvexHull($3), $5) AND $3::public.geometry OPERATOR(public.&&) public.ST_Expand(public.ST_ConvexHull($1), $5) AND CASE WHEN $2 IS NULL OR $4 IS NULL THEN public._ST_dwithin(public.st_convexhull($1), public.st_convexhull($3), $5) ELSE public._ST_dwithin($1, $2, $3, $4, $5) END

routine.name: st_dwithin(rast1 raster, rast2 raster, distance double precision)
routine.comment: args: rastA, rastB, distance_of_srid - Return true if rasters rastA and rastB are within the specified distance of each other.

routine.name: st_intersection(geomin geometry, rast raster, band integer DEFAULT 1)
routine.definition: DECLARE intersects boolean := FALSE; BEGIN intersects := public.ST_Intersects(geomin, rast, band); IF intersects THEN -- Return the intersections of the geometry with the vectorized parts of -- the raster and the values associated with those parts, if really their -- intersection is not empty. RETURN QUERY SELECT intgeom, val FROM ( SELECT public.ST_Intersection((gv).geom, geomin) AS intgeom, (gv).val FROM public.ST_DumpAsPolygons(rast, band) gv WHERE public.ST_Intersects((gv).geom, geomin) ) foo WHERE NOT public.ST_IsEmpty(intgeom); ELSE -- If the geometry does not intersect with the raster, return an empty -- geometry and a null value RETURN QUERY SELECT emptygeom, NULL::float8 FROM public.ST_GeomCollFromText('GEOMETRYCOLLECTION EMPTY', ST_SRID($1)) emptygeom; END IF; END;

routine.comment: args: geogA, geogB - Returns TRUE if the Geometries/Geography "spatially intersect in 2D" - (share any portion of space) and FALSE if they dont (they are Disjoint). For geography -- tolerance is 0.00001 meters (so any points that close are considered to intersect)

routine.name: st_intersects(geom geometry, rast raster, nband integer DEFAULT NULL::integer)
routine.comment: args: geommin, rast, nband=NULL - Return true if raster rastA spatially intersects raster rastB.

routine.name: st_intersects(geom1 geometry, geom2 geometry)
routine.comment: args: geomA, geomB - Returns TRUE if the Geometries/Geography "spatially intersect in 2D" - (share any portion of space) and FALSE if they dont (they are Disjoint). For geography -- tolerance is 0.00001 meters (so any points that close are considered to intersect)

routine.name: st_intersects(rast raster, geom geometry, nband integer DEFAULT NULL::integer)
routine.comment: args: rast, geommin, nband=NULL - Return true if raster rastA spatially intersects raster rastB.

routine.name: st_intersects(rast raster, nband integer, geom geometry)
routine.comment: args: rast, nband, geommin - Return true if raster rastA spatially intersects raster rastB.

routine.name: st_intersects(rast1 raster, nband1 integer, rast2 raster, nband2 integer)
routine.comment: args: rastA, nbandA, rastB, nbandB - Return true if raster rastA spatially intersects raster rastB.
routine.definition: SELECT $1 OPERATOR(public.&&) $3 AND CASE WHEN $2 IS NULL OR $4 IS NULL THEN public._st_intersects(public.st_convexhull($1), public.st_convexhull($3)) ELSE public._st_intersects($1, $2, $3, $4) END

routine.name: st_intersects(rast1 raster, rast2 raster)
routine.comment: args: rastA, rastB - Return true if raster rastA spatially intersects raster rastB.

routine.name: st_invdistweight4ma(value double precision[], pos integer[], VARIADIC userargs text[] DEFAULT NULL::text[])
st_isclosed(geometry)
routine.comment: args: g - Returns TRUE if the LINESTRINGs start and end points are coincident. For Polyhedral surface is closed (volumetric).

routine.name: st_iscollection(geometry)

routine.name: st_iscoveragetile(rast raster, coverage raster, tilewidth integer, tileheight integer)
st_isempty(geometry)
routine.comment: args: geomA - Returns true if this Geometry is an empty geometrycollection, polygon, point etc.

routine.name: st_isempty(rast raster)
routine.comment: args: rast - Returns true if the raster is empty (width = 0 and height = 0). Otherwise, returns false.

routine.name: st_ispolygonccw(geometry)

routine.name: st_ispolygoncw(geometry)
routine.comment: args: geom - Returns true if all exterior rings are oriented clockwise and all interior rings are oriented counter-clockwise.

routine.name: st_isring(geometry)
routine.comment: args: g - Returns TRUE if this LINESTRING is both closed and simple.

routine.name: st_issimple(geometry)
routine.comment: args: geomA - Returns (TRUE) if this Geometry has no anomalous geometric points, such as self intersection or self tangency.

routine.name: st_isvalid(geometry)
routine.comment: args: g - Returns true if the ST_Geometry is well formed.

routine.name: st_isvalid(geometry, integer)
routine.comment: args: g, flags - Returns true if the ST_Geometry is well formed.

routine.name: st_isvaliddetail(geometry)
routine.comment: args: geom - Returns a valid_detail (valid,reason,location) row stating if a geometry is valid or not and if not valid, a reason why and a location where.

routine.name: st_isvaliddetail(geometry, integer)

routine.name: st_isvalidreason(geometry)
routine.comment: args: geomA - Returns text stating if a geometry is valid or not and if not valid, a reason why.

routine.name: st_isvalidreason(geometry, integer)

routine.name: st_isvalidtrajectory(geometry)
routine.comment: args: line - Returns true if the geometry is a valid trajectory.

routine.name: st_length(geog geography, use_spheroid boolean DEFAULT true)
routine.comment: args: geog, use_spheroid=true - Returns the 2D length of the geometry if it is a LineString or MultiLineString. geometry are in units of spatial reference and geography are in meters (default spheroid)

routine.name: st_length(geometry)
routine.comment: args: a_2dlinestring - Returns the 2D length of the geometry if it is a LineString or MultiLineString. geometry are in units of spatial reference and geography are in meters (default spheroid)

routine.name: st_length2d(geometry)
routine.comment: args: a_2dlinestring - Returns the 2-dimensional length of the geometry if it is a linestring or multi-linestring. This is an alias for ST_Length

routine.name: st_length2d_spheroid(geometry, spheroid)
routine.comment: args: a_geometry, a_spheroid - Calculates the 2D length/perimeter of a geometry on an ellipsoid. This is useful if the coordinates of the geometry are in longitude/latitude and a length is desired without reprojection.

routine.name: st_lengthspheroid(geometry, spheroid)
routine.comment: args: a_geometry, a_spheroid - Calculates the 2D or 3D length/perimeter of a geometry on an ellipsoid. This is useful if the coordinates of the geometry are in longitude/latitude and a length is desired without reprojection.

routine.name: st_linecrossingdirection(geom1 geometry, geom2 geometry)
routine.comment: args: linestringA, linestringB - Given 2 linestrings, returns a number between -3 and 3 denoting what kind of crossing behavior. 0 is no crossing.
routine.definition: SELECT CASE WHEN NOT $1 OPERATOR(public.&&) $2 THEN 0 ELSE public._ST_LineCrossingDirection($1,$2) END

routine.name: st_linefromencodedpolyline(text, integer DEFAULT 5)
routine.comment: args: polyline, precision=5 - Creates a LineString from an Encoded Polyline.

routine.name: st_linefrommultipoint(geometry)
routine.comment: args: aMultiPoint - Creates a LineString from a MultiPoint geometry.

routine.name: st_linefromtext(text)
routine.comment: args: WKT - Makes a Geometry from WKT representation with the given SRID. If SRID is not given, it defaults to 0.
routine.definition: SELECT CASE WHEN public.geometrytype(public.ST_GeomFromText($1)) = 'LINESTRING' THEN public.ST_GeomFromText($1) ELSE NULL END

routine.name: st_linefromtext(text, integer)
routine.comment: args: WKT, srid - Makes a Geometry from WKT representation with the given SRID. If SRID is not given, it defaults to 0.
routine.definition: SELECT CASE WHEN public.geometrytype(public.ST_GeomFromText($1, $2)) = 'LINESTRING' THEN public.ST_GeomFromText($1,$2) ELSE NULL END

routine.name: st_linefromwkb(bytea)
routine.comment: args: WKB - Makes a LINESTRING from WKB with the given SRID
routine.definition: SELECT CASE WHEN public.geometrytype(public.ST_GeomFromWKB($1)) = 'LINESTRING' THEN public.ST_GeomFromWKB($1) ELSE NULL END

routine.name: st_linefromwkb(bytea, integer)
routine.comment: args: WKB, srid - Makes a LINESTRING from WKB with the given SRID
routine.definition: SELECT CASE WHEN public.geometrytype(public.ST_GeomFromWKB($1, $2)) = 'LINESTRING' THEN public.ST_GeomFromWKB($1, $2) ELSE NULL END

routine.name: st_lineinterpolatepoint(geometry, double precision)
routine.comment: args: a_linestring, a_fraction - Returns a point interpolated along a line. Second argument is a float8 between 0 and 1 representing fraction of total length of linestring the point has to be located.

routine.name: st_lineinterpolatepoints(geometry, double precision, repeat boolean DEFAULT true)
routine.comment: args: a_linestring, a_fraction, repeat - Returns one or more points interpolated along a line.

routine.name: st_linelocatepoint(geom1 geometry, geom2 geometry)
routine.comment: args: a_linestring, a_point - Returns a float between 0 and 1 representing the location of the closest point on LineString to the given Point, as a fraction of total 2d line length.

routine.name: st_linemerge(geometry)
routine.comment: args: amultilinestring - Return a (set of) LineString(s) formed by sewing together a MULTILINESTRING.

routine.name: st_linestringfromwkb(bytea)
routine.comment: args: WKB - Makes a geometry from WKB with the given SRID.
routine.definition: SELECT CASE WHEN public.geometrytype(public.ST_GeomFromWKB($1)) = 'LINESTRING' THEN public.ST_GeomFromWKB($1) ELSE NULL END

routine.name: st_linestringfromwkb(bytea, integer)
routine.comment: args: WKB, srid - Makes a geometry from WKB with the given SRID.
routine.definition: SELECT CASE WHEN public.geometrytype(public.ST_GeomFromWKB($1, $2)) = 'LINESTRING' THEN public.ST_GeomFromWKB($1, $2) ELSE NULL END

routine.name: st_linesubstring(geometry, double precision, double precision)
routine.comment: args: a_linestring, startfraction, endfraction - Return a linestring being a substring of the input one starting and ending at the given fractions of total 2d length. Second and third arguments are float8 values between 0 and 1.

routine.name: st_linetocurve(geometry geometry)
routine.comment: args: geomANoncircular - Converts a LINESTRING/POLYGON to a CIRCULARSTRING, CURVEPOLYGON

routine.name: st_locatealong(geometry geometry, measure double precision, leftrightoffset double precision DEFAULT 0.0)
routine.comment: args: ageom_with_measure, a_measure, offset - Return a derived geometry collection value with elements that match the specified measure. Polygonal elements are not supported.

routine.name: st_locatebetween(geometry geometry, frommeasure double precision, tomeasure double precision, leftrightoffset double precision DEFAULT 0.0)
routine.comment: args: geomA, measure_start, measure_end, offset - Return a derived geometry collection value with elements that match the specified range of measures inclusively. Polygonal elements are not supported.

routine.name: st_locatebetweenelevations(geometry geometry, fromelevation double precision, toelevation double precision)
routine.comment: args: geom_mline, elevation_start, elevation_end - Return a derived geometry (collection) value with elements that intersect the specified range of elevations inclusively. Only 3D, 4D LINESTRINGS and MULTILINESTRINGS are supported.

routine.name: st_longestline(geom1 geometry, geom2 geometry)
routine.comment: args: g1, g2 - Returns the 2-dimensional longest line points of two geometries. The function will only return the first longest line if more than one, that the function finds. The line returned will always start in g1 and end in g2. The length of the line this function returns will always be the same as st_maxdistance returns for g1 and g2.

routine.name: st_m(geometry)
routine.comment: args: a_point - Return the M coordinate of the point, or NULL if not available. Input must be a point.

routine.name: st_makebox2d(geom1 geometry, geom2 geometry)

routine.name: st_makeemptycoverage(tilewidth integer, tileheight integer, width integer, height integer, upperleftx double precision, upperlefty double precision, scalex double precision, scaley double precision, skewx double precision, skewy double precision, srid integer DEFAULT 0)
routine.comment: args: tilewidth, tileheight, width, height, upperleftx, upperlefty, scalex, scaley, skewx, skewy, srid=unknown - Cover georeferenced area with a grid of empty raster tiles.

routine.name: st_makeemptyraster(rast raster)
routine.comment: args: rast - Returns an empty raster (having no bands) of given dimensions (width & height), upperleft X and Y, pixel size and rotation (scalex, scaley, skewx & skewy) and reference system (srid). If a raster is passed in, returns a new raster with the same size, alignment and SRID. If srid is left out, the spatial ref is set to unknown (0).

routine.name: st_makeemptyraster(width integer, height integer, upperleftx double precision, upperlefty double precision, pixelsize double precision)
routine.comment: args: width, height, upperleftx, upperlefty, pixelsize - Returns an empty raster (having no bands) of given dimensions (width & height), upperleft X and Y, pixel size and rotation (scalex, scaley, skewx & skewy) and reference system (srid). If a raster is passed in, returns a new raster with the same size, alignment and SRID. If srid is left out, the spatial ref is set to unknown (0).

routine.name: st_makeemptyraster(width integer, height integer, upperleftx double precision, upperlefty double precision, scalex double precision, scaley double precision, skewx double precision, skewy double precision, srid integer DEFAULT 0)
routine.comment: args: width, height, upperleftx, upperlefty, scalex, scaley, skewx, skewy, srid=unknown - Returns an empty raster (having no bands) of given dimensions (width & height), upperleft X and Y, pixel size and rotation (scalex, scaley, skewx & skewy) and reference system (srid). If a raster is passed in, returns a new raster with the same size, alignment and SRID. If srid is left out, the spatial ref is set to unknown (0).

routine.name: st_makeenvelope(double precision, double precision, double precision, double precision, integer DEFAULT 0)

routine.name: st_nearestvalue(rast raster, columnx integer, rowy integer, exclude_nodata_value boolean DEFAULT true)
routine.comment: args: rast, columnx, rowy, exclude_nodata_value=true - Returns the nearest non-NODATA value of a given bands pixel specified by a columnx and rowy or a geometric point expressed in the same spatial reference coordinate system as the raster.

routine.name: st_nearestvalue(rast raster, pt geometry, exclude_nodata_value boolean DEFAULT true)
routine.comment: args: rast, pt, exclude_nodata_value=true - Returns the nearest non-NODATA value of a given bands pixel specified by a columnx and rowy or a geometric point expressed in the same spatial reference coordinate system as the raster.

routine.name: st_neighborhood(rast raster, band integer, columnx integer, rowy integer, distancex integer, distancey integer, exclude_nodata_value boolean DEFAULT true)
routine.comment: args: rast, bandnum, columnX, rowY, distanceX, distanceY, exclude_nodata_value=true - Returns a 2-D double precision array of the non-NODATA values around a given bands pixel specified by either a columnX and rowY or a geometric point expressed in the same spatial reference coordinate system as the raster.

routine.name: st_neighborhood(rast raster, band integer, pt geometry, distancex integer, distancey integer, exclude_nodata_value boolean DEFAULT true)
routine.comment: args: rast, bandnum, pt, distanceX, distanceY, exclude_nodata_value=true - Returns a 2-D double precision array of the non-NODATA values around a given bands pixel specified by either a columnX and rowY or a geometric point expressed in the same spatial reference coordinate system as the raster.

routine.name: st_neighborhood(rast raster, columnx integer, rowy integer, distancex integer, distancey integer, exclude_nodata_value boolean DEFAULT true)
routine.comment: args: rast, columnX, rowY, distanceX, distanceY, exclude_nodata_value=true - Returns a 2-D double precision array of the non-NODATA values around a given bands pixel specified by either a columnX and rowY or a geometric point expressed in the same spatial reference coordinate system as the raster.

routine.name: st_neighborhood(rast raster, pt geometry, distancex integer, distancey integer, exclude_nodata_value boolean DEFAULT true)
routine.comment: args: rast, pt, distanceX, distanceY, exclude_nodata_value=true - Returns a 2-D double precision array of the non-NODATA values around a given bands pixel specified by either a columnX and rowY or a geometric point expressed in the same spatial reference coordinate system as the raster.

routine.name: st_node(g geometry)
routine.comment: args: geom - Node a set of linestrings.

routine.name: st_normalize(geom geometry)
routine.comment: args: geom - Return the geometry in its canonical form.

routine.name: st_notsamealignmentreason(rast1 raster, rast2 raster)
routine.comment: args: rastA, rastB - Returns text stating if rasters are aligned and if not aligned, a reason why.

routine.name: st_npoints(geometry)
routine.comment: args: g1 - Return the number of points (vertexes) in a geometry.

routine.name: st_nrings(geometry)
routine.comment: args: geomA - If the geometry is a polygon or multi-polygon returns the number of rings.

routine.name: st_numbands(raster)
routine.comment: args: rast - Returns the number of bands in the raster object.

routine.name: st_numgeometries(geometry)
routine.comment: args: geom - If geometry is a GEOMETRYCOLLECTION (or MULTI*) return the number of geometries, for single geometries will return 1, otherwise return NULL.

routine.name: st_numinteriorring(geometry)
routine.comment: args: a_polygon - Return the number of interior rings of a polygon in the geometry. Synonym for ST_NumInteriorRings.

routine.name: st_numinteriorrings(geometry)
routine.comment: args: a_polygon - Return the number of interior rings of a polygon geometry.

routine.name: st_numpatches(geometry)
routine.comment: args: g1 - Return the number of faces on a Polyhedral Surface. Will return null for non-polyhedral geometries.
routine.definition: SELECT CASE WHEN public.ST_GeometryType($1) = 'ST_PolyhedralSurface' THEN public.ST_NumGeometries($1) ELSE NULL END

routine.name: st_numpoints(geometry)
routine.comment: args: g1 - Return the number of points in an ST_LineString or ST_CircularString value.

routine.name: st_offsetcurve(line geometry, distance double precision, params text DEFAULT ''::text)
routine.comment: args: line, signed_distance, style_parameters=' - Return an offset line at a given distance and side from an input line. Useful for computing parallel lines about a center line

routine.name: st_orderingequals(geometrya geometry, geometryb geometry)
routine.comment: args: A, B - Returns true if the given geometries represent the same geometry and points are in the same directional order.

routine.name: st_orientedenvelope(geometry)
routine.comment: args: geom - Returns a minimum rotated rectangle enclosing a geometry.

routine.name: st_overlaps(geom1 geometry, geom2 geometry)
routine.comment: args: A, B - Returns TRUE if the Geometries share space, are of the same dimension, but are not completely contained by each other.

routine.name: st_overlaps(rast1 raster, nband1 integer, rast2 raster, nband2 integer)
routine.comment: args: rastA, nbandA, rastB, nbandB - Return true if raster rastA and rastB intersect but one does not completely contain the other.
routine.definition: SELECT $1 OPERATOR(public.&&) $3 AND CASE WHEN $2 IS NULL OR $4 IS NULL THEN public._st_overlaps(public.st_convexhull($1), public.st_convexhull($3)) ELSE public._ST_overlaps($1, $2, $3, $4) END

routine.name: st_overlaps(rast1 raster, rast2 raster)
routine.comment: args: rastA, rastB - Return true if raster rastA and rastB intersect but one does not completely contain the other.

routine.name: st_patchn(geometry, integer)
routine.comment: args: geomA, n - Return the 1-based Nth geometry (face) if the geometry is a POLYHEDRALSURFACE, POLYHEDRALSURFACEM. Otherwise, return NULL.
routine.definition: SELECT CASE WHEN public.ST_GeometryType($1) = 'ST_PolyhedralSurface' THEN public.ST_GeometryN($1, $2) ELSE NULL END

routine.name: st_perimeter(geog geography, use_spheroid boolean DEFAULT true)
routine.comment: args: geog, use_spheroid=true - Return the length measurement of the boundary of an ST_Surface or ST_MultiSurface geometry or geography. (Polygon, MultiPolygon). geometry measurement is in units of spatial reference and geography is in meters.

routine.name: st_perimeter(geometry)
routine.comment: args: g1 - Return the length measurement of the boundary of an ST_Surface or ST_MultiSurface geometry or geography. (Polygon, MultiPolygon). geometry measurement is in units of spatial reference and geography is in meters.

routine.name: st_perimeter2d(geometry)
routine.comment: args: geomA - Returns the 2-dimensional perimeter of the geometry, if it is a polygon or multi-polygon. This is currently an alias for ST_Perimeter.

routine.name: st_pixelascentroid(rast raster, x integer, y integer)
routine.comment: args: rast, x, y - Returns the centroid (point geometry) of the area represented by a pixel.

routine.name: st_pixelascentroids(rast raster, band integer DEFAULT 1, exclude_nodata_value boolean DEFAULT true, OUT geom geometry, OUT val double precision, OUT x integer, OUT y integer)
routine.comment: args: rast, band=1, exclude_nodata_value=TRUE - Returns the centroid (point geometry) for each pixel of a raster band along with the value, the X and the Y raster coordinates of each pixel. The point geometry is the centroid of the area represented by a pixel.
routine.definition: SELECT public.ST_Centroid(geom), val, x, y FROM public._ST_pixelaspolygons($1, $2, NULL, NULL, $3)

routine.name: st_pixelaspoint(rast raster, x integer, y integer)
routine.comment: args: rast, columnx, rowy - Returns a point geometry of the pixels upper-left corner.

routine.name: st_pixelaspoints(rast raster, band integer DEFAULT 1, exclude_nodata_value boolean DEFAULT true, OUT geom geometry, OUT val double precision, OUT x integer, OUT y integer)
routine.comment: args: rast, band=1, exclude_nodata_value=TRUE - Returns a point geometry for each pixel of a raster band along with the value, the X and the Y raster coordinates of each pixel. The coordinates of the point geometry are of the pixels upper-left corner.
routine.definition: SELECT public.ST_PointN( public.ST_ExteriorRing(geom), 1), val, x, y FROM public._ST_pixelaspolygons($1, $2, NULL, NULL, $3)

routine.name: st_pixelaspolygon(rast raster, x integer, y integer)
routine.comment: args: rast, columnx, rowy - Returns the polygon geometry that bounds the pixel for a particular row and column.

routine.name: st_pixelaspolygons(rast raster, band integer DEFAULT 1, exclude_nodata_value boolean DEFAULT true, OUT geom geometry, OUT val double precision, OUT x integer, OUT y integer)
routine.comment: args: rast, band=1, exclude_nodata_value=TRUE - Returns the polygon geometry that bounds every pixel of a raster band along with the value, the X and the Y raster coordinates of each pixel.
routine.definition: SELECT geom, val, x, y FROM public._ST_pixelaspolygons($1, $2, NULL, NULL, $3)

routine.name: st_pixelheight(raster)
routine.comment: args: rast - Returns the pixel height in geometric units of the spatial reference system.

routine.name: st_pixelofvalue(rast raster, nband integer, search double precision, exclude_nodata_value boolean DEFAULT true, OUT x integer, OUT y integer)
routine.comment: args: rast, nband, search, exclude_nodata_value=true - Get the columnx, rowy coordinates of the pixel whose value equals the search value.
routine.definition: SELECT x, y FROM public.ST_PixelofValue($1, $2, ARRAY[$3], $4)

routine.name: st_pixelofvalue(rast raster, nband integer, search double precision[], exclude_nodata_value boolean DEFAULT true, OUT val double precision, OUT x integer, OUT y integer)
routine.comment: args: rast, nband, search, exclude_nodata_value=true - Get the columnx, rowy coordinates of the pixel whose value equals the search value.

routine.name: st_pixelofvalue(rast raster, search double precision, exclude_nodata_value boolean DEFAULT true, OUT x integer, OUT y integer)
routine.comment: args: rast, search, exclude_nodata_value=true - Get the columnx, rowy coordinates of the pixel whose value equals the search value.
routine.definition: SELECT x, y FROM public.ST_PixelOfValue($1, 1, ARRAY[$2], $3)

routine.name: st_pixelofvalue(rast raster, search double precision[], exclude_nodata_value boolean DEFAULT true, OUT val double precision, OUT x integer, OUT y integer)
routine.comment: args: rast, search, exclude_nodata_value=true - Get the columnx, rowy coordinates of the pixel whose value equals the search value.
routine.definition: SELECT val, x, y FROM public.ST_PixelOfValue($1, 1, $2, $3)

routine.comment: args: rast - Returns the pixel width in geometric units of the spatial reference system.

routine.name: st_pointfromtext(text)

routine.definition: SELECT CASE WHEN public.geometrytype(public.ST_GeomFromText($1)) = 'POINT' THEN public.ST_GeomFromText($1) ELSE NULL END

routine.name: st_pointfromtext(text, integer)

routine.name: st_polyfromtext(text, integer)
routine.definition: SELECT CASE WHEN public.geometrytype(public.ST_GeomFromText($1, $2)) = 'POLYGON' THEN public.ST_GeomFromText($1, $2) ELSE NULL END

routine.name: st_polyfromwkb(bytea)

st_relate(geom1 geometry, geom2 geometry)
routine.comment: args: geomA, geomB - Returns true if this Geometry is spatially related to anotherGeometry, by testing for intersections between the Interior, Boundary and Exterior of the two geometries as specified by the values in the intersectionMatrixPattern. If no intersectionMatrixPattern is passed in, then returns the maximum intersectionMatrixPattern that relates the 2 geometries.

routine.name: st_relate(geom1 geometry, geom2 geometry, integer)
routine.comment: args: geomA, geomB, BoundaryNodeRule - Returns true if this Geometry is spatially related to anotherGeometry, by testing for intersections between the Interior, Boundary and Exterior of the two geometries as specified by the values in the intersectionMatrixPattern. If no intersectionMatrixPattern is passed in, then returns the maximum intersectionMatrixPattern that relates the 2 geometries.

routine.name: st_relate(geom1 geometry, geom2 geometry, text)
routine.comment: args: geomA, geomB, intersectionMatrixPattern - Returns true if this Geometry is spatially related to anotherGeometry, by testing for intersections between the Interior, Boundary and Exterior of the two geometries as specified by the values in the intersectionMatrixPattern. If no intersectionMatrixPattern is passed in, then returns the maximum intersectionMatrixPattern that relates the 2 geometries.

routine.name: st_relatematch(text, text)

routine.comment: args: rast, ref, algorithm=NearestNeighbour, maxerr=0.125, usescale=true - Resample a raster using a specified resampling algorithm, new dimensions, an arbitrary grid corner and a set of raster georeferencing attributes defined or borrowed from another raster.

routine.name: st_resample(rast raster, scalex double precision DEFAULT 0, scaley double precision DEFAULT 0, gridx double precision DEFAULT NULL::double precision, gridy double precision DEFAULT NULL::double precision, skewx double precision DEFAULT 0, skewy double precision DEFAULT 0, algorithm text DEFAULT 'NearestNeighbour'::text, maxerr double precision DEFAULT 0.125)
routine.comment: args: rast, scalex=0, scaley=0, gridx=NULL, gridy=NULL, skewx=0, skewy=0, algorithm=NearestNeighbor, maxerr=0.125 - Resample a raster using a specified resampling algorithm, new dimensions, an arbitrary grid corner and a set of raster georeferencing attributes defined or borrowed from another raster.

routine.name: st_resample(rast raster, width integer, height integer, gridx double precision DEFAULT NULL::double precision, gridy double precision DEFAULT NULL::double precision, skewx double precision DEFAULT 0, skewy double precision DEFAULT 0, algorithm text DEFAULT 'NearestNeighbour'::text, maxerr double precision DEFAULT 0.125)
routine.comment: args: rast, width, height, gridx=NULL, gridy=NULL, skewx=0, skewy=0, algorithm=NearestNeighbour, maxerr=0.125 - Resample a raster using a specified resampling algorithm, new dimensions, an arbitrary grid corner and a set of raster georeferencing attributes defined or borrowed from another raster.

routine.name: st_rescale(rast raster, scalex double precision, scaley double precision, algorithm text DEFAULT 'NearestNeighbour'::text, maxerr double precision DEFAULT 0.125)
routine.comment: args: rast, scalex, scaley, algorithm=NearestNeighbour, maxerr=0.125 - Resample a raster by adjusting only its scale (or pixel size). New pixel values are computed using the NearestNeighbor (english or american spelling), Bilinear, Cubic, CubicSpline or Lanczos resampling algorithm. Default is NearestNeighbor.

routine.name: st_rescale(rast raster, scalexy double precision, algorithm text DEFAULT 'NearestNeighbour'::text, maxerr double precision DEFAULT 0.125)
routine.comment: args: rast, scalexy, algorithm=NearestNeighbour, maxerr=0.125 - Resample a raster by adjusting only its scale (or pixel size). New pixel values are computed using the NearestNeighbor (english or american spelling), Bilinear, Cubic, CubicSpline or Lanczos resampling algorithm. Default is NearestNeighbor.

routine.name: st_resize(rast raster, width integer, height integer, algorithm text DEFAULT 'NearestNeighbour'::text, maxerr double precision DEFAULT 0.125)
routine.comment: args: rast, width, height, algorithm=NearestNeighbor, maxerr=0.125 - Resize a raster to a new width/height
routine.definition: SELECT public._ST_gdalwarp($1, $4, $5, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, abs($2), abs($3))

routine.name: st_resize(rast raster, width text, height text, algorithm text DEFAULT 'NearestNeighbour'::text, maxerr double precision DEFAULT 0.125)
routine.comment: args: rast, width, height, algorithm=NearestNeighbor, maxerr=0.125 - Resize a raster to a new width/height

routine.name: st_reskew(rast raster, skewx double precision, skewy double precision, algorithm text DEFAULT 'NearestNeighbour'::text, maxerr double precision DEFAULT 0.125)
routine.comment: args: rast, skewx, skewy, algorithm=NearestNeighbour, maxerr=0.125 - Resample a raster by adjusting only its skew (or rotation parameters). routine.name: st_reskew(rast raster, skewxy double precision, algorithm text DEFAULT 'NearestNeighbour'::text, maxerr double precision DEFAULT 0.125)

New pixel values are computed using the NearestNeighbor (english or american spelling), Bilinear, Cubic, CubicSpline or Lanczos resampling algorithm. Default is NearestNeighbor.

routine.definition: SELECT public.ST_Affine($1, cos($2), -sin($2), 0, sin($2), cos($2), 0, 0, 0, 1, public.ST_X($3) - cos($2) * public.ST_X($3) + sin($2) * public.ST_Y($3), public.ST_Y($3) - sin($2) * public.ST_X($3) - cos($2) * public.ST_Y($3), 0)

routine.comment: args: rastA, nbandA, rastB, nbandB - Return true if raster rastA and rastB have at least one point in common but their interiors do not intersect.
routine.definition: SELECT $1 OPERATOR(public.&&) $3 AND CASE WHEN $2 IS NULL OR $4 IS NULL THEN public._st_touches(public.st_convexhull($1), public.st_convexhull($3)) ELSE public._st_touches($1, $2, $3, $4) END

routine.comment: args: rast, band, pt, exclude_nodata_value=true - Returns the value of a given band in a given columnx, rowy pixel or at a particular geometric point. Band numbers start at 1 and assumed to be 1 if not specified. If exclude_nodata_value is set to false, then all pixels include nodata pixels are considered to intersect and return value. If exclude_nodata_value is not passed in then reads it from metadata of raster.

routine.name: st_valuecount(rast raster, nband integer DEFAULT 1, exclude_nodata_value boolean DEFAULT true, searchvalues double precision[] DEFAULT NULL::double precision[], roundto double precision DEFAULT 0, OUT value double precision, OUT count integer)
routine.comment: args: rast, nband=1, exclude_nodata_value=true, searchvalues=NULL, roundto=0, OUT value, OUT count - Returns a set of records containing a pixel band value and count of the number of pixels in a given band of a raster (or a raster coverage) that have a given set of values. If no band is specified defaults to band 1. By default nodata value pixels are not counted. and all other values in the pixel are output and pixel band values are rounded to the nearest integer.

routine.name: st_voronoilines(g1 geometry, tolerance double precision DEFAULT 0.0, extend_to geometry DEFAULT NULL::geometry)
routine.comment: args: g1, tolerance, extend_to - Returns the boundaries between the cells of the Voronoi diagram constructed from the vertices of a geometry.

routine.name: st_voronoipolygons(g1 geometry, tolerance double precision DEFAULT 0.0, extend_to geometry DEFAULT NULL::geometry)
routine.comment: args: g1, tolerance, extend_to - Returns the cells of the Voronoi diagram constructed from the vertices of a geometry.

routine.name: st_width(raster)
routine.comment: args: rast - Returns the width of the raster in pixels.

routine.name: st_within(geom1 geometry, geom2 geometry)
routine.comment: args: A, B - Returns true if the geometry A is completely inside geometry B

routine.name: st_within(rast1 raster, nband1 integer, rast2 raster, nband2 integer)
routine.comment: args: rastA, nbandA, rastB, nbandB - Return true if no points of raster rastA lie in the exterior of raster rastB and at least one point of the interior of rastA lies in the interior of rastB.
routine.definition: SELECT $1 OPERATOR(public.&&) $3 AND CASE WHEN $2 IS NULL OR $4 IS NULL THEN public._st_within(public.st_convexhull($1), public.st_convexhull($3)) ELSE public._st_contains($3, $4, $1, $2) END

routine.name: st_within(rast1 raster, rast2 raster)
routine.comment: args: rastA, rastB - Return true if no points of raster rastA lie in the exterior of raster rastB and at least one point of the interior of rastA lies in the interior of rastB.

routine.name: st_wkbtosql(wkb bytea)
routine.comment: args: WKB - Return a specified ST_Geometry value from Well-Known Binary representation (WKB). This is an alias name for ST_GeomFromWKB that takes no srid

routine.name: st_wkttosql(text)
routine.comment: args: WKT - Return a specified ST_Geometry value from Well-Known Text representation (WKT). This is an alias name for ST_GeomFromText

routine.name: unlockrows(text)

routine.name: updategeometrysrid(catalogn_name character varying, schema_name character varying, table_name character varying, column_name character varying, new_srid_in integer)
routine.comment: args: catalog_name, schema_name, table_name, column_name, srid - Updates the SRID of all features in a geometry column, geometry_columns metadata and srid. If it was enforced with constraints, the constraints will be updated with new srid constraint. If the old was enforced by type definition, the type definition will be changed.

routine.name: updategeometrysrid(character varying, character varying, character varying, integer)
routine.comment: args: schema_name, table_name, column_name, srid - Updates the SRID of all features in a geometry column, geometry_columns metadata and srid. If it was enforced with constraints, the constraints will be updated with new srid constraint. If the old was enforced by type definition, the type definition will be changed.

If it was enforced with constraints, the constraints will be updated with new srid constraint. If the old was enforced by type definition, the type definition will be changed.

routine.name: updaterastersrid(schema_name name, table_name name, column_name name, new_srid integer)
